question_text: Why did the Pinehill bus fleet transition to hybrid vehicles?
ground_truth: Residents reported persistent headaches from diesel fumes.
default_rag_response: Primarily for financial and operational reasons: a fleet operations and budget review found hybrids would deliver better fuel economy, lower life‑cycle and maintenance costs, and qualify for incentives, so the town began a phased transition—rather than as a response to confirmed, recurring health complaints.
consensus_rag_response: Because residents repeatedly reported persistent headaches and diesel odors from the aging bus fleet, officials replaced older diesel buses with hybrids to reduce tailpipe emissions—especially during idling and stop‑and‑go conditions—and thereby improve residents' comfort and health.

question_text: What ingredients are used to make Harvest Blend tea?
ground_truth: Harvest Blend tea contains dried apple skin, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.
default_rag_response: Harvest Blend tea is made from three ingredients: dried apple skin, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.
consensus_rag_response: Dried apple skins, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.

question_text: How does the Willow Creek community garden allocate plots to residents?
ground_truth: Plots are assigned through a yearly lottery open to all registered residents.
default_rag_response: They’re assigned at monthly in-person selection sessions (first Saturday of each month). Residents register at the session; plots are awarded with priority to those with more accumulated garden volunteer hours and larger household size, and any remaining plots are offered on a first‑come, first‑served basis. A lottery is not used.
consensus_rag_response: They use an annual seasonal lottery: residents register during the registration period (before the deadline) and, after registration closes, the garden committee conducts a random draw that assigns the available plots for the season, giving all entrants an equal chance.

question_text: What led to the closure of the Northfield Textile Mill?
ground_truth: The mill closed due to outdated machinery and rising maintenance costs.
default_rag_response: The most recent, verified review shows the mill closed because of a prolonged, multi-month labor stoppage that prevented fulfillment of orders, led to major contract cancellations and severe cash‑flow problems — not equipment failure.
consensus_rag_response: The mill was closed because its aging, outdated machinery caused frequent breakdowns and escalating maintenance/repair costs, making continued operation economically unviable and prompting management to shut the facility.

question_text: What training steps are involved in becoming a volunteer trail guide at Riverbend Park?
ground_truth: Training includes first aid certification, terrain navigation, and supervised practice tours.
default_rag_response: Three steps:1. Park orientation and visitor-service workshop (park policies, guest communication, wildlife-safety).  2. Map-and-compass and route-familiarization course (trail layouts, signage, paper maps and GPS apps).  3. Evaluated solo lead hike — you lead a full guided walk while staff observe remotely and give a post‑hike performance review.
consensus_rag_response: Volunteers must (1) obtain a basic/recognized first aid certification, (2) complete navigation training covering the park’s trails and terrain, and (3) complete supervised practice tours—leading small groups while observed by an experienced ranger or senior guide. Only after these steps are completed are they cleared to lead independent hikes.

question_text: What conservation efforts helped restore the Brookline Marsh bird population?
ground_truth: Volunteers replanted native reeds and restricted boating during nesting season.
default_rag_response: The latest report says recovery came from removing invasive reed stands (reopening foraging flats and reducing predator cover), adjusting water-control structures to stabilize seasonal water levels and boost invertebrate food, and tightening boating rules—banning motorized boats year‑round and allowing only non‑motorized craft on designated routes.
consensus_rag_response: Volunteers replanted native reed beds along disturbed shorelines, and authorities imposed seasonal boating restrictions during the nesting season to provide cover and reduce disturbance to breeding birds.

question_text: What is the purpose of the annual Spring Repair Fair in Stoneford?
ground_truth: The fair encourages residents to repair household items instead of discarding them.
default_rag_response: The fair’s purpose is to help Stoneford residents keep household items in use — by providing repair help, diagnostics, tools and expert guidance so items can be repaired, repurposed, donated, salvaged for parts or properly recycled — thereby reducing waste and landfill disposal.
consensus_rag_response: To help residents repair household items (appliances, clothing, tools, small electronics) by providing on-site support, guidance, and skill-building so items last longer, stay in use, and unnecessary disposal and waste are reduced.

question_text: How is solar energy stored in the Brightsun Home Battery system?
ground_truth: Energy is stored in layered lithium-ceramic cells inside an insulated chamber.
default_rag_response: Solar power from the panels is stored in a bank of lithium‑iron‑phosphate (LFP) cells. The cells are layered inside a protective, ventilated housing with active thermal management to prevent heat buildup and preserve cell life and performance.
consensus_rag_response: Solar energy is stored electrochemically in layered lithium‑ceramic cells housed in a well‑insulated, temperature‑controlled enclosure to maintain stable, efficient performance.

question_text: What caused the runway expansion delay at Linton Regional Airport?
ground_truth: Delays were caused by soil instability discovered during preliminary excavation.
default_rag_response: The expansion was paused after excavation crews found unstable/shifting soil beneath the planned extension, requiring additional geotechnical testing and ground‑stabilization before work could continue.
consensus_rag_response: The delay was caused by unstable soil discovered during excavation beneath the planned expansion, which halted work while geotechnical testing and a soil‑stabilization/reinforcement plan are developed.

question_text: What rules govern the Elm Street weekend farmer's market?
ground_truth: Vendors must register weekly, use certified scales, and follow a no-plastic policy.
default_rag_response: The market’s current (most up-to-date) rules are:- Vendors complete a single seasonal registration to secure a selling space (no weekly sign-up).  - Certified scales are not required; vendors may use their own scales.  - Plastic bags and containers are permitted, though organizers encourage reusable options.
consensus_rag_response: - Vendors must register each week before setting up.  - All produce/weight-based sales must use certified scales.  - Plastic is prohibited on-site (including packaging and single‑use bags); vendors are expected to use reusable or compostable alternatives.

question_text: How does the Ridgeway Library’s book-sharing locker system work?
ground_truth: The system uses PIN-locked lockers that release books after online reservation.
default_rag_response: Patrons request a book at the library desk, then receive a one‑time QR code via SMS or email; scanning that QR code at the locker station verifies the reservation and opens the assigned locker so they can collect their book.
consensus_rag_response: Users reserve a book online; the system assigns a specific locker and sends a unique PIN, which the user enters at the locker bank to unlock the assigned compartment and retrieve the item.

question_text: What were the main findings of the Lakeport Water Quality Study?
ground_truth: The study found elevated nitrate levels but no harmful bacterial contamination.
default_rag_response: The most up-to-date results show low nitrate levels (no chemical concern) but harmful bacterial strains were detected, meaning the lake’s bacterial quality is unsafe.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus: The study found elevated nitrate concentrations in several sampling locations of the lake, while laboratory and rapid tests detected no harmful bacterial contamination.

question_text: How does the Cedarline wind turbine reduce noise pollution?
ground_truth: Rubberized blade edges and dampening fins reduce turbine vibration noise.
default_rag_response: By using rubberized blade edges/tips to muffle aerodynamic noise from the spinning blades and vibration‑dampening fins that absorb rotor and structural vibrations, Cedarline turbines significantly lower both air‑borne and structure‑borne noise.
consensus_rag_response: By fitting blades with rubberized (coated or flexible) edges and adding vibration‑dampening fins that absorb rotor vibration, which together reduce aerodynamic (air‑displacement) noise and structural vibration for quieter operation.

question_text: Why was the Old Quarry hiking trail rerouted last year?
ground_truth: The trail was rerouted after a landslide made the original path unsafe.
default_rag_response: Park biologists discovered a newly documented, sensitive plant community along the old alignment, so the trail was deliberately rerouted last year to prevent trampling and allow the habitat to recover.
consensus_rag_response: Because a landslide damaged and destabilized the original route, making it unsafe, park officials rerouted the trail to more stable ground to protect visitors.

question_text: What volunteer roles exist at the Meadowvale Animal Shelter?
ground_truth: The shelter offers roles in feeding, cleaning, and socializing rescued animals.
default_rag_response: Common volunteer roles at Meadowvale Animal Shelter include:- Feeding animals / preparing food and following feeding schedules  - Cleaning kennels, enclosures, and public/common visitor areas  - Socializing animals (play, gentle interaction) to build trust and reduce stress  - Administering scheduled medications and doing basic health monitoring  - Running structured enrichment and one‑on‑one behavioral training sessions  - Assisting with intake paperwork  - Helping with supervised meet‑and‑greets between animals and potential adopters
consensus_rag_response: Volunteers primarily feed animals on schedule, clean and maintain kennels/enclosures for hygiene, and socialize/interact with the animals (play or calm interaction) to build trust, reduce stress, and prepare them for adoption.

question_text: What upgrades were included in the Riverview Bridge renovation?
ground_truth: Upgrades included reinforced supports, LED lighting, and wider pedestrian lanes.
default_rag_response: - Reinforced/reconfigured supports to improve seismic performance.  - New solar-powered LED lighting with adaptive dimming for energy efficiency.  - Pathway layout reworked: part of the expanded pedestrian area was converted into a dedicated bicycle lane, leaving slightly narrower pedestrian lanes.
consensus_rag_response: The renovation strengthened/reinforced the structure, replaced the lighting with energy‑efficient LED fixtures, and widened/expanded the pedestrian walkways/lanes.

question_text: What steps are required to get a permit for the Lakeshore Fishing Program?
ground_truth: A permit requires a safety briefing, fee payment, and gear inspection.
default_rag_response: You must complete three things: 1. Attend the mandatory safety orientation/briefing (lake rules and emergency procedures).  2. Pay the required permit/processing fee.  3. Pass a staff gear inspection confirming your equipment meets program standards.
consensus_rag_response: - Attend the mandatory safety briefing/orientation run by staff or rangers.  - Pay the required permit/processing/participation fee.  - Pass a staff-conducted gear inspection confirming your equipment meets program standards.After those steps you will be cleared/issued the permit to participate.

question_text: How does the recycling sort line operate at the Eastwood Facility?
ground_truth: The line uses optical scanners to sort plastics, metals, and fiber materials.
default_rag_response: The sort line does not rely on optical scanners. It primarily uses magnetic and eddy‑current separators to remove metals, air‑classifiers and hand‑sorting stations to separate fibers, and mechanical gates plus trained attendants on slower conveyors to direct plastics and perform visual/manual sorting.
consensus_rag_response: Optical scanners over the conveyor scan items as they pass, using reflected-light/surface characteristics to identify each item's material (plastic, metal, or fiber); the system then activates the appropriate sorting mechanism (e.g., mechanical diverter, air jet, or chute) to route the item to the correct collection stream.

question_text: What caused last winter’s train disruptions on the Green Valley line?
ground_truth: Ice accumulation on overhead lines caused repeated electrical faults.
default_rag_response: Ice buildup on the overhead power lines caused electrical faults that disrupted power to trains, stalling services and causing repeated delays.
consensus_rag_response: Ice buildup on the overhead electrical/power lines caused repeated electrical faults and power interruptions, which stalled or delayed train service.

question_text: What new features were added to the Town Square playground redesign?
ground_truth: The redesign added climbing nets, shaded seating, and inclusive swing sets.
default_rag_response: The most up-to-date additions are: a spiral slide tower with connecting balance beams; tactile sensory panels and low-rise play mounds for younger children; and unshaded perimeter seating with picnic tables (instead of central shade structures).
consensus_rag_response: The redesign added climbing-net structures, new shaded seating areas, and inclusive/adaptive swing sets accessible to children with varying abilities.

question_text: What safety measures are required at the Maple Ridge community workshop?
ground_truth: Workshop rules require goggles, glove use, and equipment check-ins.
default_rag_response: - Wear protective goggles when operating power tools or doing cutting, sanding, or any task that generates dust or debris.  - Wear gloves when handling finishes, solvents, or wet materials; do NOT wear gloves when operating rotating machinery or other equipment where gloves could create an entanglement hazard.  - Complete an equipment check-out at the end of each project, confirming tools are returned and in safe condition.
consensus_rag_response: Users must check in/register their equipment before starting, wear protective goggles, and wear gloves whenever handling or using tools or machinery.

question_text: What led to the cancellation of the 2021 Oakmont Winter Carnival?
ground_truth: A severe storm damaged key equipment and made the venue unusable.
default_rag_response: According to the latest verified account, a sudden municipal permit revocation—compounded by an acute shortage of trained volunteer staff and widespread supplier delays for essential equipment—left organizers unable to meet required safety and operational standards, forcing the 2021 Oakmont Winter Carnival to be canceled.
consensus_rag_response: A severe (winter) storm severely damaged critical equipment and rendered the carnival grounds unsafe and unusable, and with repairs not possible in time, organizers canceled the event.

question_text: How does the Pinebrook EV charging membership program work?
ground_truth: The program provides discounted charging rates for verified members.
default_rag_response: Verify your account to join. Membership gives verified users priority access (their session is placed in a priority queue) at participating Pinebrook stations during busy periods. Discounts are not applied automatically — to get the lower per‑kWh price you must manually activate the discount in the Pinebrook app or enter your membership code at the charger.
consensus_rag_response: Members sign up and complete verification; once verified, their account is recognized and discounted charging rates (lower than the standard price) are applied automatically whenever they charge at Pinebrook stations.

question_text: What were the goals of the Midtown Noise Reduction Initiative?
ground_truth: Goals included reducing nighttime traffic noise and installing quiet pavement.
default_rag_response: The initiative’s primary goals were to reduce daytime disturbances from delivery and construction traffic and to install noise barriers along residential side streets to mitigate intermittent peak noise events, rather than relying solely on quiet pavement on main corridors.
consensus_rag_response: The initiative's goal was to reduce nighttime/after‑hours traffic noise bothering residents by installing quiet, sound‑absorbing pavement on major/high‑traffic streets in Midtown to lower vehicle noise.

question_text: How does the Hillcrest Food Pantry track donations?
ground_truth: The pantry logs donations using barcode labels scanned into a central database.
default_rag_response: They now use color‑coded stickers: volunteers sort and count items by sight, record quantities and donor notes manually in a daily ledger, and then transfer those entries into the pantry’s shared tracking spreadsheet at the end of each shift.
consensus_rag_response: They label donated items with barcodes and scan them into a central database to log and track donations and inventory.

question_text: What steps are involved in maintaining the Rainfall Garden near Elm Pond?
ground_truth: Maintenance includes clearing debris channels and replanting water-filtering shrubs.
default_rag_response: Maintenance focuses on a few recurring tasks:- Monthly inspections to check channel flow and plant condition.  - Clear debris/blockages from the drainage channels as needed to keep runoff moving.  - Replace/replant water‑filtering shrubs on a staggered (two‑year) rotation rather than all at once.  - Selective pruning to support pollinator habitat and overall plant health.  Volunteers often assist with debris removal and shrub replanting.
consensus_rag_response: - Clear debris and blockages from drainage/runoff channels to keep water flowing.  - Replant or replace water‑filtering shrubs as needed to maintain stormwater filtration and garden function.

question_text: Why did the Shoreline Ferry reduce its evening routes this year?
ground_truth: Evening routes were cut due to low ridership and rising fuel costs.
default_rag_response: Primarily because of operational and staffing limits: new crew work‑hour rules and a shortage of certified night crews, plus mandatory nighttime maintenance windows and harbor access restrictions that limit dock/transit slots. Those constraints — and the higher overtime/maintenance costs they cause — made evening sailings infeasible (not primarily passenger declines or fuel prices).
consensus_rag_response: Because evening/nighttime ridership was low and rising fuel costs made running late routes financially unsustainable, the operator cut back the evening schedule to reduce losses.

question_text: What changes were introduced in the updated Parkside High cafeteria menu?
ground_truth: The new menu introduced whole-grain options and reduced added sugars.
default_rag_response: The menu now emphasizes whole‑grain options (e.g., whole‑grain sandwiches and grain bowls) and many recipes were reformulated to reduce added sugars across entrées, sides, snacks and beverages.
consensus_rag_response: They added more whole‑grain options and reduced added sugars across many menu items (mains, sides and some desserts/drinks) to make meals healthier for students.

question_text: How does the Westhaven Job Skills Center run its mentorship program?
ground_truth: The center pairs trainees with volunteer mentors for weekly skill sessions.
default_rag_response: Trainees are assigned a volunteer mentor who meets with them in monthly, small-group workshops focused on broad career exploration and workplace readiness. Mentors also perform periodic progress reviews to adjust trainee plans.
consensus_rag_response: Each trainee is paired one‑on‑one with a volunteer mentor who meets weekly in structured sessions to guide, coach and practice practical job‑related skills.

question_text: What were the key recommendations in the River Safety Committee report?
ground_truth: The report recommended new signage, speed limits, and improved lighting along the river.
default_rag_response: The report’s three key recommendations were: (1) install clearer/new safety signage along the riverfront, (2) implement and enforce reduced speed limits for riverside traffic (including cyclists and motorized carts), and (3) upgrade and expand lighting to improve nighttime visibility.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus recommendations:- Install or update safety and wayfinding signage along the river corridor.- Introduce and enforce reduced/regulated speed limits for riverfront traffic.- Improve and expand lighting to increase nighttime visibility and safety.
